gameDetails.venue: MGM Grand Garden Arena, Las Vegas

recentPerformance.seasonAverage: Houston allows 62.5 PPG, Tennessee allows 59.3 PPG
recentPerformance.cushion: Both teams bottom half of tempo nationally

keyFactors.title: Elite Defenses
keyFactors.description: Houston #1 in adjusted defensive efficiency, Tennessee #6. Both teams prioritize defense.

keyFactors.title: Slow Tempo
keyFactors.description: Both teams in bottom half of tempo nationally - expected grind-it-out game

keyFactors.title: Neutral Site
keyFactors.description: Players Era Championship at MGM Grand - no home crowd advantage for either team

riskFactors: Elite teams can get into shootouts despite defensive identity
Neutral site games can be unpredictable
Both teams have capable offensive players

gillespie.note: Made all 6 free throws in final 35 seconds - ice cold

boswell.note: Including two clutch FTs with 25 seconds left

uzan.note: Playing in hometown, missed halfcourt buzzer-beater that would have forced OT

sharp.note: Limited to 21 minutes due to foul trouble - huge factor

quarterBreakdown.description: Houston built 11-point lead midway through first half. Tennessee trailed at halftime for first time this season. Emanuel Sharp limited to 21 minutes due to foul trouble.
Tennessee went on 10-0 run to take 51-46 lead. Houston went 7:24 between points, missed 11 straight shots. Gillespie clutch with 6/6 FT in final 35 seconds. Uzan's halfcourt buzzer-beater missed.

gameResults.whenMissed: First half alone had 70 points - under was essentially dead at halftime
gameResults.gamePace: Much faster than expected - both teams pushed in transition more than usual
gameResults.turningPoint: Tennessee's second half rally opened up scoring on both ends

whatWentWrong.title: Unexpected Offensive Output
whatWentWrong.description: Both teams shot better than season averages - Houston's Flemings (25) and Uzan (17) exceeded expectations

whatWentWrong.title: Transition Points
whatWentWrong.description: More fast break opportunities than typical for these slow-tempo teams

whatWentWrong.title: Free Throw Parade
whatWentWrong.description: Combined 45 free throw attempts inflated score beyond defensive effort

statisticalContext.vsSeasonAverage: 149 total vs ~125 expected based on defensive ratings
statisticalContext.vsRecentForm: Both teams exceeded their scoring averages significantly
statisticalContext.percentileRanking: Top 15% scoring output for both teams this season

postGameAnalysis.wasNormalVariance: This was high variance - two elite defensive teams combining for 149 points is an outlier. The thesis was sound but execution on both offenses exceeded expectations.

closingLineValue.verdict: Slight negative CLV - line moved slightly against us. Market may have anticipated higher scoring game.

keyTakeaways: Elite defensive teams can still have high-scoring games in neutral site tournaments
Free throws can significantly inflate totals beyond expected pace
Tennessee's second half rally opened up scoring on both ends
Thesis was sound but variance struck - 149 total is outlier for these teams
Neutral site tournament games create unpredictable environments
verdict: Process was correct - two elite defenses should produce under. This was high variance loss. Would bet this spot again with same information.
